page.title: 11Geology around Heybridge
page.content: The town of Maldon itself sits on a hill which is composed of boulder clay Around Heybridge the soil is mainly sandy loams which means the soil is very gravelly.Sandy loams occur along the main river valleys such as the Blackwater and Chelmer. Underneath sandy loams are layers of gravel and sand.They are extracted by companies and are sold to help build roads and houses.The main two gravel pits in the area are at Loft Farm (Grid ref. 8607,0901) and Chigborough Pits (Grid ref. 8706,0804). There is some local opposition to further gravel pit working which is now a thriving local{industry.} However, the companies have landscaped and stocked with fish exhausted workings and have thus increased the{ area's{recreational}facilities.
